title: An Ode to the Abuelos of Cinema
description: In 'Blue Beetle,' Nana Reyes steals the show. She reminds us that we'll never know our grandparents’ whole stories until we ask.

title: The Story Behind HBO’s Telemarketers—and How It Exposes a Billion-Dollar Scam
description: Filmmaker Sam Lipman-Stern on bringing the wild scam story to screen

title: How COVID-19 Changes the Immune System
description: Innate immune cells remain altered for at least a year after infection.

title: Which Candidates Will Be on Stage for the First Republican Debate?
description: Several candidates have qualified for the first debate, which is scheduled for Wednesday, Aug. 23.

title: A New Technique Uses a Patient’s Own Stem Cells to Restore Their Vision
description: The experimental new technique uses stem cells to help restore vision.

description: The Georgia indictment is the fourth criminal case leveled against Donald Trump, who was charged along with 18 others.

description: What to expect in the 2023 Women's World Cup final.

title: Biden Administration Expands Temporary Status for Ukrainians in the U.S.
description: The move is expected to make 166,700 Ukrainians eligible for Temporary Protected Status, up from about 26,000 currently.

title: Legal Challenges to Abortion Medication Could Set Off a Domino Effect for Access
description: If mifepristone becomes harder to access, so too may all abortions.

description: Blue Beetle is a character with a long history in the DC comics. Here's what you need to know about his past and his future in the new DCU.

title: Maui’s Emergency Services Chief Resigns
description: He had said this week that he had no regrets about not deploying the outdoor alert system on the island during the fire.

description: Jessica Simpson and Nick Lachey's MTV reality sensation, which premiered 20 years ago, laid the foundation for a generation of relatable content.

description: Author and co-showrunner Jenny Han breaks down Belly's decision between Conrad and Jeremiah and what to expect in Season 3.

description: China appears to be constructing an airstrip on a disputed South China Sea island according to satellite photos.

description: Here’s everything to know about the current state of weed regulation in Japan—and where it could go next.

description: Modernizing the electric grid and planning for extreme weather events needs to be a priority in a changing climate.

title: Health Insurance Reform Has Surprisingly Little Impact on Actual Health
description: The key to improving health for Americans is far more complex than health insurance reform, write Liran Einav and Amy Finkelstein.

title: Taliban Official Says Women Lose Value if Their Faces Are Visible to Men in Public
description: Afghanistan's religious scholars agree that a woman must keep her face covered when outside the home, a Taliban spokesperson said.

title: Hurricane Hilary Grows to Category 4 and Could Bring Heavy Rain to U.S. Southwest
description: Hurricane Hilary could bring heavy rain to the southwestern U.S. by the weekend, the U.S. National Hurricane Center said.

title: Chinese Version of ‘The Voice’ Rocked by Allegations of Unfairly Treating Late Star
description: The production company behind the reality singing program saw its stock tumble after allegations that Coco Lee was unfairly treated during her time on the show.

title: These Are the Three Candidates Vying to Be Singapore’s Next President
description: Singaporeans will vote on Sept. 1 for just the third time since a constitutional amendment in 1991 transformed the presidency into a publicly elected post.

title: The U.S. Is Beefing Up Alliances Across Asia—But Don’t Expect an ‘Asian NATO’ Anytime Soon
description: As the U.S., Japan, and South Korea bolster their security ties, experts point to a number of obstacles preventing a NATO-like entity forming anytime soon in Asia.

description: As the U.S., Japan, and South Korea bolster their security ties, experts point to a number of obstacles preventing a NATO-like entity forming anytime soon in Asia.

title: China Is Desperate to Boost Its Low Birth Rates. It May Have to Accept the New Normal
description: China’s efforts to lift birth rates, experts say, may be futile. Instead, authorities should focus on boosting automation, immigration, and eldercare.
